--- title: "Regression and Statistical Inference" --- # Assignment 1 ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_959d76c3973ad6a47570fc2c92acefb1'} ```{.r .cell-code} car_prices <- readRDS("C:/Users/Marcel/Master/DataScience/data/car_prices.rds") dim(car_prices) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 181 22 ``` ::: ::: The data has 22 rows and 181 columns. # Assignment 2 ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_92e61a2ce964af57092cb43b8ffd698c'} ```{.r .cell-code} head(car_prices) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: The data contains Strings \ and numbers \. Numbers can be compared and ordered by size and used for maths, while strings can mainly be checked for equality. (Or ordered by their characters) # Assignment 3 ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_b233addbc49df9d69da8faba9f08103a'} ```{.r .cell-code} lm_all <- lm(price ~ ., data = car_prices) summary(lm_all,digits = 2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = price ~ ., data = car_prices) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -5662 -1120 0 798 9040 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. 167.148 0.926 0.355761 #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 2189 on 143 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.9415, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9264 #> F-statistic: 62.21 on 37 and 143 DF, p-value: < 2.2e-16 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #confint(lm_all, level = 0.95) ``` ::: # Assignment 4 The peakrpm is a number that takes on values between 4200 and 6600 in our data. Increasing the peakrpm by one would increase the price of the vehicle by \$2.56. This result is statistically significant as it has three stars in the summary table which correspond to a p-value between 0 and 0.001. # Assignment 5 ::: {.cell hash='03_regression_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_5441337e5957124b6a8e860e770b3077'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) new <- car_prices %>% mutate(seat_heating = TRUE) lm_all <- lm(price ~ ., data = new) summary(lm_all,digits = 2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = price ~ ., data = new) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -5662 -1120 0 798 9040 #> #> Coefficients: (1 not defined because of singularities) #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) -36269.965 15460.866 -2.346 0.020354 * #> aspirationturbo 1846.206 1041.391 1.773 0.078386 . #> doornumbertwo 242.523 571.929 0.424 0.672172 #> carbodyhardtop value is the same for each entry the regression doe not know what would change if the seat_heating value would change.
